qas.question: What year was the first nickel hydrogen battery used?
In what year did the hubble space telescope finally get the nickel hydrogen battery?

context: The nickel hydrogen battery was used for the first time in <a0_0>1977<a0_0/> aboard the U.S. Navy's Navigation technology satellite-2 (NTS-2). For example, the ISS, Mars Odyssey and the Mars Global Surveyor are equipped with nickel-hydrogen batteries. In the dark part of its orbit, the Hubble Space Telescope is also powered by nickel-hydrogen batteries, which were finally replaced in May <a1_0>2009<a1_0/>, more than 19 years after launch, and 13 years over their design life.
